Key Match Events: Luka Doncic scored 14 of his 32 points in the first quarter
Dallas notched its highest-scoring first period of the season to take a 30-22 lead after one quarter and never trailed thereafter
Dallas led by as many as 33 points
Orlando made just eight of 41 3-point attempts and were outscored 52-36 in the paint
Post-Match Reflections: Doncic said, 'Today was real fun. We were guarding everybody, defending, rebounding, playing with a lot of pace. So that's fun for me.'

Mavs coach Jason Kidd said, 'I thought he [Klay Thompson] played a great game. I know we look at him for scoring and shooting threes, but I thought his playmaking, his energy was high. He was moving on both ends at a very high level.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Klay Thompson had a quiet night with nine points on four-of-10 shooting, connecting on just one of his five 3-point attempts
The Detroit Pistons claimed their second victory of the season, 106-92 over the Nets in Brooklyn

Atlanta's Jalen Johnson scored 29 points and Trae Young added 23 points, four rebounds, 12 assists and a steal as the Hawks handed the injury-depleted Pelicans their first home defeat this season, 126-111
Zion Williamson, CJ McCollum, and Herbert Jones were ruled out due to injuries
JD Cagulangan is beginning his KBL stint in Korea
